Table of ContentsğŸ”½The Monk who Returned to Study from Tang, Yuanxing, states: Yuanxing was selected in the Wuwu year.
He was ordered to
seek further teachings.
He visited the Western Sea to seek the Way.
In the twelfth month of that year, he arrived at Chang'an City.
In the first month of the jimao year, on the thirteenth day,
he presented a memorial requesting to reside at Qinglong Temple by imperial decree.
Fortunately, he met the Dharma Master of the Esoteric Teaching at that temple, the Venerable Monk Yizhen, who became his teacher.
His great virtue was as a disciple of the Ä€cÄrya Huiguo, and he was a Dharma heir of the Venerable Monk Yichao, a fellow disciple.
He was well-versed in the Three Teachings,
and skillfully understood the Five Divisions.
He was the pillar of the Dharma,
and the refuge of the country. Yuanxing fortunately relied on the great grace of the imperial court,
and the deep kindness of his teacher.
He resolved the great Dharma of the two divisions,
and awakened to the secret Dharma of the various honored ones.
On the second day of the intercalary first month, he was granted the position of acharya and abhisheka.
The left street's meritorious minister, the monk-in-charge, and the great virtuous ones of the Vajra Gate all gathered at the dharma assembly to rejoice together.
As for this dharma, contemplating the moon disc is to abide in the ordinary stage and be endowed with the virtues of the Buddha.
Reciting the secret words of the mouth is to ascend to the stage of great enlightenment in an instant without passing through long eons.
Therefore Nagarjuna said:
Riding a sheep,
one's wishes are difficult to reach far away. Riding a horse, one gradually reaches a faster pace.
Riding the divine path, one arrives upon thinking of it.
This is the difference between exoteric and esoteric.
It is also said in the secret scriptures:
One good man establishes a ritual arena and cultivates the three secrets.
Within his country, there will be no disasters of the seven difficulties.
The blessings and longevity of the king and ministers will increase day by day.
This is the power of mantras.
Nevertheless, the waves churn the Han River.
The wind and rain drift the ship.
Crossing the vast ocean, it returns to the sacred realm.
This is the power of the sages.
I humbly believe that Your Majesty's merit surpasses the ultimate, and your Way surpasses the primordial.
Praising the precious plan of Emperor Yao.
Again continuing the great work of Yu.
Feeling pity for the people and stopping to rest.
Relying on the Buddha's entrustment and wearing the robe.
Because Your Majesty promotes the Buddha's teachings,
the relics of Maitreya gradually come from afar.
Because Your Majesty nurtures the people of the country with kindness,
the secret scriptures and teachings reach the shore from afar.
The transmission of the secret teachings is not without reason.
It is the power of the Buddha's original blessings and wisdom.
The power of the inherent empowerment of the nature of the Dharma realm.

He was then conferred the perfect practice.
The catalog of the sutras, Dharma, relics, and ritual implements that were conferred is in a separate document.
I respectfully present this, lightly disturbing your majestic dignity, and I am even more terrified.
